sect2.title: Introduction to Procmail
sect2.para: The Procmail package contains an autonomous mail processor. This is useful for filtering and sorting incoming mail.

sect2.title: Installation of Procmail
sect2.para: Install Procmail by running the following commands:

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: make LOCKINGTEST=/tmp install: This prevents make from asking you where to test file-locking patterns.
make install-suid: Modifies permissions of the installed files.

sect3.title: Configuration Information
sect3.para: Recipes have to be written and placed in your ~/.procmailrc for execution. The procmailex man page is the starting place to learn how to write recipes.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Procmail package contains procmail, formail, lockfile and mailstat.

sect3.title: procmail
sect3.para: procmail is an autonomous mail processor. It performs all the functions of a MDA (Mail Delivery Agent).

sect3.title: formail
sect3.para: formail is a filter that can be used to format mail into mailbox format.

sect3.title: lockfile
sect3.para: lockfile is a utility that can lock a file for single use interactively or in a script.

sect3.title: mailstat
sect3.para: mailstat prints a summary report of mail that has been filtered by procmail since the last time mailstat was ran.
